review:
I am hungry and want to escape poverty. I have been having a hard time with schools like w3 where it seems like they just kind of throw the kitchen sink at you but don‚Äôt give you the information in any sort of order of importance. In contrast this app orders topics in a way that makes sense for what someone would use most often. 

It‚Äôs non-invasive ads and free vs premium benefits as well as an affordable premium rate make the whole package benevolent.
 Thank you. Here‚Äôs to learning
title: This app lives on my Home row.

developerResponse:
{'id': 31543483, 'body': 'Hey Nikkionmyi,


Thanks for your feedback. Currently, we do not offer offline Python: Programiz courses. But we‚Äôll take your suggestion into consideration for the future iteration of our app.

While we understand your needs, our app is more catered towards programming beginners who have never used Python before or have had very limited experience with it.



Our lesson progression focuses their attention on the only things they require to build upon the rudimentary(basic) concepts step by step. Our goal, in the grand scheme of things, is to encourage more people to get into programming through the comfort of their phones.

Having said that, we do offer to skip lessons or jump to the specific topic and more with our Programiz APP+ subscription for people who want to get the most out of our app.
', 'modified': '2022-08-19T04:04:03Z'}
review: I wanted to try this app to constantly review/practice Python that I have studied online and SAVE my data. Since this app doesn‚Äôt work w/out internet it has no purpose for me. There are plenty of online resources to review, learn, and practice Python. It is step-by-step, so best for beginner w/zero knowledge unless you don‚Äôt mind scrolling through all the basics of Python Lessons before getting to the lessons you need to learn. I.e. you can‚Äôt pick or jump to a specific part of Python coding that you want to learn/review. I can‚Äôt wait til I learn to build mobile apps so I can build something more useful.
title: Does not work without internet

review: I am learning Python simultaneously in different platforms and programs. This is complete, free and has a ton of examples to dive in. It‚Äôs didactic is concise, understandable and easy to follow. Don‚Äôt waste your time and money on mimo, which promises a certificate, luring you in, but then, there is no certificate for Python, not to mention how superficial it is. This one is a lot more complete, you have an actual IDE and shell to explore and play around. The swipe feature is extremely helpful to learn on the go, from your phone single handed!
title: If you really want to learn Python, this is it

review: Without buying the app, it shows very low amount of ads and still want you to learn with the very friendly graphical user interface, the texts are very easy to read, not too much text and makes you interested instead of boring you to read I don‚Äôt know, a chapter book about python? developerResponse: {'id': 27712236, 'body': 'Hey Carterdeville,\n\r\nThanks for taking the time to share your experience. We loved to hear that our contents are much easier to learn and understand Python.', 'modified': '2022-01-28T04:49:14Z'}
review:
I like to tinker and make things. I wanted to automate some projects but wondered if I could learn to program. This course breaks down coding into easy to understand, basic parts, allowing me to tinker with each concept so the light comes on for me.

review: I am really grateful to Programiz and Parewa Labs, wish to always remain free learning app from them. It was one of the best and rarest Python learning app. Last but not at the least thanks for iOS version also hope for iPad too. I also wish to be include more great features like IDE, sample problem and solving, comments option on every learning pages, full stack leaning resources like flask, dJango, anaconda, numpy, jupyter etc.
title: Great Food For Python Learners

review:
I have wanted to pick up a programming language for years, but felt intimidated due to the sheer leaning curve and lack of time to invest, since I already work full time in a completely different field.

This app has small lessons that can easily be completed in a few minutes and has an integrated programmer and shell to run the programs you write or investigate as you learn.

I only have one issue, no native iPad app.  This would have been 5 stars if there was a native iPad app where I could use my keyboard for the lessons.  As of now, when you download on the iPad, you get the phone app in portrait mode and it cannot flip to landscape for use with a keyboard.

I‚Äôll look for another IDE/Shell for the iPad and keep the app open on my phone on the side, I guess, but I really wish this was iPad compatible.
title: Great Tutorial for Beginners

developerResponse:
{'id': 14681170, 'body': 'Hi there,

It seems you have used the curly double quote -> ‚Äúhello World‚Äù
instead of using the straight double quote ->  "hello World"
Which is why the system returned syntax error.

You can run the code below:

 print ("hello World") 
#Happy Learning', 'modified': '2020-04-15T19:19:17Z'}
review:
Wasn‚Äôt aware there were different types of quotes thank you for the help. Revising rating.

I‚Äôll admit I‚Äôm very new to programming but I tried to scale down the simplest print code I could think of and couldn‚Äôt get it to run. But then I ran it in another IDE and it worked fine.

Example: Your app
# Write your code
print (‚Äúhello World‚Äù)

Returns syntax error right after ‚Äúhello

Example 2: Other IDE
print('Hello World')

Returns: Hello World

I‚Äôve tried it numerous was and I can get it to print numbers but not strings. Like I said I‚Äôm new to this but since this seems to work in other IDEs I‚Äôm inclined to think something is wrong here.
